data.title: Still good food and friendly staff
data.text: It has been several years since I have been here at Pogacha and was happy to find myself in the area again. I had the roasted vegetable pasta and my friend had the ravioli. Both dishes were flavorful and they provided an ample portion. The wait staff was very friendly and helpful. Parking was easy which is a bonus in Bellevue.

data.title: Catered lunch
data.text:
I ate the catered lunch that a rep brought to the office. They have excellent healthy food. The spinach salad was wonderful. The chicken or shrimp kabobs as well. The bread is like naan but fatter. 
The cookies were well I should stop. Delicious. They do cater or stop by their restaurant in Bellevue.

data.title: Always Good and Welcoming
data.text: This is a local place, sought out and frequented by locals who want a good quality affordable fare, something that you can frequent often and bring your family and friends.  Informal setting with many repeat patrons, a great place for a business get together, a party, or gathering of friends.  The owners and staff and great and become family.

data.title: A reliably good restaurant
data.text: Pogacha has been in Bellevue almost as long as I have.  It is one of the places that is always a good meal at a good price.  The menu is Mediterranean, with a broad selection of entrees.  The food has lots of fresh, tasty ingredients. The desserts are really excellent.  And the service is always friendly.

data.title: Great food, fast service.
data.text:
I loved my sausage gorgonzola pizza and the iced tea has some kind of fruity aftertaste so it didn't need sugar even though it was unsweetened.

I was in a hurry and service was fast as well. 

Would definitely return if I lived here.

data.title: Long Time Favorite
data.text: For more than 20 years Pogacha has been a great place to meet friends or bring family for lunch or dinner.  Croatian dishes and American staples.   The Pogacha bread, a Croatian bread is their signature dish whether topped with a dip or made into a pizza type dish.  This is the original location, but they now have several local larger restaurants that are equally good.

data.title: Good service
data.text: A group of us like to come here for girl's luncheon, mainly because the price is reasonable, food is okay and the service is good. Also the parking is easy!

data.title: Favorite Restaurant
data.text: Pogachas are small Croatian rolls. The restaurant bakes them in a brick (?), wood-fired oven. We generally have a salad. In addition, my husband enjoys the Margherita pizza. I often have another, different salad or the purple chicken pasta (gluten free is an option for those who prefer). Service is impeccable.

data.title: Wonderful neighborhood Cafe
data.text: Pogacha is our go-to restaurant in Bellevue.  We eat there at least every other month.  "Pogacha" is a Croatian term meaning "soft, chewy flatbread" and they are served with every meal--delicious.  They also use the bread as a base for individual pizzas which they also call pogachas.  My favorite is fresh tomato-artichoke hears and bacon. My husband's favorite dish is the Lamb Shank.  The staff is outstanding and welcoming.  They cover the tables with white butcher paper and provide crayons--'kids' of all ages are entertained.  Wines are very drink'able.  Great place to relax with friends or have a quick meal out. We also love the changing art on the walls.  Some shows are excellent, other not so much, but always fun to see what is being displayed.

data.title: fire oven to view
data.text: This venerable restaurant is a great place for lunch....their salads are imaginative and well dressed.there is a nice atmosphere as well

data.title: Good but not great restaurant
data.text:
You got to love the fresh flat bread that they back and serve with entrees.  Basically it is the pizza crust without toppings.  And fresh bread right out of the open oven can't be beat if you are a carb lover.

I always get the salads which are nice but not fantastic.  And that is my opinion about the entrees I have tried.  I like this restaurant because you don't have to park in an underground garage and it is close to downtown Bellevue and my office.  It's a nice place to get away from my desk for lunch, but not memorable.

data.title: Delightful flavors!
data.text: We had the Mediterranean chicken an lemon chicken sandwiches. ..WONDERFUL!  The flavors popped on our tongues!  Regrettably didn't have limes for our drinks. Will eat here whenever in Bellevue.

data.title: Very good food and very consistent
data.text: Pogacha is a long time restaurant in Bellevue.  The food has always been great and the service has always been top notch in our opinion without over doing it.  This is a mid-range restaurant in terms of price.

data.title: Good Food and Casual Atmosphere
data.text: Pogacha has long been a go-to restaurant for us just off the heavy traffic in downtown Bellevue.  No worries about parking in the strip mall location and reservations not usually required.  Although we usually order the Croatian flatbread (pogacha) 'pizzas', other meal selections have been consistently delicous, as well.  The pogachas are unique, diverse and always great.  Pogacha also has a good selection of wines at reasonable prices.  Service is friendly and personable – Pogacha is a tasty refuge from the nearby hustle and bustle.

data.title: Family dinner
data.text:
Good space, good value, very good food and family portions.  Corkage is available.
Service is below average, slow and forgetful; it seems that they are using their kids and friends in leiu of professional waiters.

data.title: Promising just not quite delivering
data.text: I was searching for a restaurant in Bellevue WA to take a large business group for an after conference dinner. My requirements were - something slightly unusual and interesting, ample parking, and not too far from our meeting location. Pogacha's seemed like a winner when I went for lunch and got great service and food was tasty - who's going to have tried Croatian Pizza, right? Well, on the night of my dinner I had a different waiter. Somehow our dinner suddenly was all about him. And his friends or family were sitting at a table nearby. Every time he left us, he would flop into a chair at their table and gasp for air or wipe his brow. In the end, I'm guessing we dropped about $1200 on dinners and drinks. But if I went back - I'd demand to know who my waiter was going to be to ensure I didn't get another prima donna!

data.title: Would eat there every day if I could!
data.text: Excellent mouth watering specials...lamb burger will be the only burger you will ever want again....excellent service and everything on the menu is DELISH!

data.title: Perfect pogacha hand made pizza type
data.text: I love this place, service is excellent!. Pogacha breads are the best here baked over Apple wood boards. Try them all. Salads are good portions as well as pogachas.

data.title: I enjoy here every month
data.text: Pogacha's is my longtime choice for a monthly lunch with friends.  The atmosphere, menu and price are all just right.  You can even sit outside under a veranda if the weather is warm.  The staff is always friendly.  Some people who are hard of hearing would prefer a quieter place so they can talk. I usually ask for a table by the wall as there is a higher noise level.  It's a great place for a nice lunch with friends and family.  A business deal might be harder to do because of the lively atmosphere.

data.title: Always a great eat!
data.text: Great food and always great service. We always keep Pogacha in our minds whenever we want to take someone out as it is consistently excellent. The warm bread baked in their wood fired oven is wonderful. Salads are great and their Pizzas are amazing. Think we will go there tonight.
